meanings.definition: To harden or solidify by depositing calcium salts.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the bone would calcify over time.
meanings.sent2: If you leave a seashell in vinegar, it will eventually calcify.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled milk on the floor, and now it's starting to calcify!
meanings.sent4: Her heart seemed to calcify with each disappointment, becoming harder and harder.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins were so old that they seemed to calcify into the landscape itself.

meanings.definition: To become hardened or solidified by depositing calcium salts.
meanings.sent1: The coral reef began to calcify, forming a protective barrier.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the old pipes in the house started to calcify and clog.
meanings.sent3: The spilled milk on the floor started to calcify, creating a strange pattern.
meanings.sent4: His mind seemed to calcify with age, becoming less flexible and open to new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The once flowing river began to calcify, turning into a solid, rocky stream.
